PatientMatching.TEXT:
Record date: 2065-06-28
Chief Complaint
The patient presents for ongoing care of her diabetes and leg pain.
History of Present Illness
Ms Barrera is an 85 yo woman accompanied by her daughter, Uhura. She has a h/o DM, HTN, GERD, LBP and CAD. She was formerly followed by Dr. Laura Link and is transferring her care. She has not had any CP or SOB -- her ETT MIBI in 2062 revealed mild ischemia in the inferior wall and EF of 63%. She has had not diabetic complications. Her last A1C was 5.9 in February. She reports significant R>L LE pain that limits her mobilitiy. This has been ongoing for some time but is getting worse. No pain at rest; only with walking. She rarely takes anything for the pain. She wonders if she needs to monitor her glucose.
PMH as above.
Habits: no exercise. No tobacco or EtOH
FH non contributory
SH: lives alone in an apartment in a senior home. Daughter involved in her care.
Medications
ECASA 325MG PO QD
ATENOLOL 100MG PO QD
GLYBURIDE 2.5MG PO QD
HCTZ 50MG PO QD
LISINOPRIL 20MG PO QD
ZOCOR 20MG PO QHS
KCL IMMEDIATE REL. 10MEQ 2 Capsule(s) PO QD
NORVASC (AMLODIPINE) 5MG 1 Tablet(s) PO QD
OSCAL+D (CALCIUM CARBONATE + VIT D(1TABLE... PO BID
TYLENOL (ACETAMINOPHEN) 500MG 1 Capsule(s) PO Q4H
Physical Exam
WDWN F, NAD
153# R 160/70 L154/70 P64 R12
Chest: CTA/P
Cor: RRR, S1, S2, No MRG
Abd: Soft, NT. +BS. No HSM
Ext: No C/C/E; no focal tenderness; B/L lateral thigh pain with internal rotation of hips.
Assessment
1. DM - well-controlled. check A1C. On ace-i. up to date with optho and podiatry; no indication for home BS monitoring at this time.
2. HTN - will increase lisinopril from 10 to 20 mg qd; check lytes
3. Hip pain - likely OA. will obtain hip films and prescribe tylenol 500mg q6hrs prn.
4. constipation - using senekot and metamucil with good results.
5. Lipids - LDL 59, HDL 37 in February. Continue zocor.
6. HCM-UTD.
The patient will f/u with me in 12-16 weeks, or sooner prn.
______________________________
Xenakis, Tracy T., M.D.
**************************************************************************************************** Record date: 2066-02-12
Patient Name: BARRERA,MARY [ MRN: 45167459SLO ]
Date of Visit: 02/12/2066
Chief Complaint
The patient presents for care of pain in her legs.
History of Present Illness
86F reports worsening b/l leg pain. Pain only occurs when she walks. No trauma. No pain at rest. Pain is in both legs and can't be localized to any specific part of her leg. No pain when lying down. She takes tylenol bid which helps somewhat, but is now less effective than previously.
No problems with medications. No CP or new numbness or weakness. No problems with GERD. No new muscle pain. No symptoms of hypo- or hyperglycemia.
Pt recently had brain MRI ordered by ophtho for ? R hemianonymous hemianopsia. MRI revealed multiple lacunes.
Medications
ECASA 325MG PO QD
ZOCOR 20MG PO QHS
TYLENOL (ACETAMINOPHEN) 500MG 1 Capsule(s) PO Q4H
OSCAL+D (CALCIUM CARBONATE + VIT D(1TABLE... 500MG PO BID
KCL SLOW REL. 10MEQ 2 Tablet(s) PO QD
ATENOLOL 100MG PO QD
GLYBURIDE 2.5MG PO QD
HCTZ 50MG PO QD
LISINOPRIL 40MG PO QD
NORVASC (AMLODIPINE) 10MG 1 Tablet(s) PO QD
Physical Exam
WDWN elderly F, NAD
175/70 P64 R12 153#
Chest: CTA/P
Cor: RRR, S1, S2, No MRG
Abd: Soft, NT. +BS. No HSM
Ext: No C/C/E; FROM; SLR negative bilaterally; no focal tenderness; no knee or hip pain.
Assessment
1. AODM - last A1C=5.3; will recheck today, but d/c glyburide
2. HTN - increase lisinopril to 40 mg and norvasc to 10; check chem
3. OA - vioxx 12.5 qd with tylenol bid prn.
4. Multiple lacunes - control htn
5. CAD, PVD and hiatal hernia - stable
The patient will f/u with me in 3 mos, or sooner prn.
______________________________
Tracy T. Xenakis, M.D.
**************************************************************************************************** Record date: 2068-04-06
Patient Name: BARRERA,MARY U [ 45167459(SLO) ]
Date of Visit: 04/06/2068
Chief Complaint
The patient presents for care of recent fall, HTN, DM and hyperlipidemia.
History of Present Illness
88F with CAD, DM, HTN, hyperlipidemia and LE pain.
Not seen in ~10 mos. Feels generally well until fall 6d ago. Pt unclear as to reasons of fall but confident that she didn't blackout or feel faint. Pt thinks she may have slipped. was not using walker at home. was able to get up immediately afterwards and felt fine until soreness set in the next AM. She now reports improving bruise on her head, LBP and L toe pain.
Pt lives in assisted living facility where meals are prepared for her, etc.
Pt does c/o R sided hip and leg pain that worsens when she walks. No LE swelling. No numbness or weakness.
Reports taking all the meds she's been prescribed but doesn't know names.
Medications
ATENOLOL 100 MG PO QD
HCTZ 50 MG PO QD
LISINOPRIL 40 MG PO QD
ZOCOR 20 MG PO QHS
Norvasc (AMLODIPINE) 10MG TABLET take 1 Tablet(s) PO QD
Oscal+d (CALCIUM Carbonate + Vit D(1TABLE... 500 MG PO BID
Tylenol (ACETAMINOPHEN) 500MG CAPSULE take 1 Capsule(s) PO Q4H PRN knee pain
Kcl Slow Rel. 10MEQ TABLET CR take 2 Tablet(s) PO QD
Asa (ACETYLSALICYLIC Acid) 81MG TABLET take 1 Tablet(s) PO QD
Physical Exam
WDWN frail F, NAD
157# 114/64 P72 R12
HEENT: NC. 1 cm hematoma on occiput; slightly tender.
Chest: CTA/P
Back: no focal tenderness; SLR slightly positive on R
Cor: RRR, S1, S2, No MRG
Abd: Soft, NT. +BS. No HSM
Ext: No C/C/E; reflexes trace or absent bilaterally
Romberg positive
Assessment
1. s/p fall - likely due to mechanical fall, possibly due to deconditioning, weakness and poor balance. will ask PT to do home safety eval and make recommendations
2. R hip/leg pain - likely sciatica and/or hip OA. check L/S films to r/o compression fx and hip films; refer for home PT
3. DM - check A1C and chem panel
4. HTN - check chem panel
5. Lipids - check lipids
6. Med adherence - pt to bring in meds to all visits.
The patient will f/u with me in 6-8 weeks, or sooner prn.
______________________________
Tracy T. Xenakis, M.D.
****************************************************************************************************
